bill_title: allow weights and measures inspections to be performed biennially.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow weights and measures inspections to be preformed biennially. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 37-21-18 be amended to read as follows: 37-21-18. Any person who , by himself, or by his servant or agent or as the servant or agent of another person : (1) Shall offer or expose Offers or exposes for sale, sell, use sells, uses in buying or selling of any commodity or thing, or for hire or award, or retain retains in his possession a false weight or measure or measuring or weighing device, or any weight or measure or weighing or measuring device which that has not been sealed by the Division of Commercial Inspection and Regulation within one year two years ; or (2) Shall dispose Disposes of any condemned weight, measure, or weighing or measuring device contrary to law; or (3) Shall remove Removes any tag placed thereon by the Division of Commercial Inspection and Regulation; or (4) Shall sell or offer or expose Sells, offers, or exposes for sale less than the quantity he the person represents; or (5) Shall take or attempt Takes or attempts to take more than the quantity he the person represents, when as the buyer, he the person furnished the weight, measure, or weighing or measuring device by means of which the amount of the commodity is determined; or (6) Shall keep Keeps for the purpose of sale, offer or expose offers or exposes for sale, or sell sells any commodity in a manner contrary to law; or (7) Shall violate Violates any provision of chapters 37-20 to 37-22, inclusive, for which a specific penalty has not been provided; or (8) Shall sell or offer Sells, offers to sell or use or have , uses, or has in his possession for the purpose of selling or using any device or instrument to be used, or calculated to falsify any weight or measure; is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor.
